cast.overview: When a zombie virus pushes Korea into a state of emergency, those trapped on an express train to Busan must fight for their own survival.
cast.title: Train to Busan

cast.overview: May, 1980. Man-seob is a taxi driver in Seoul who lives from hand to mouth, raising his young daughter alone. One day, he hears that there is a foreigner who will pay big money for a drive down to Gwangju city. Not knowing that he’s a German journalist with a hidden agenda, Man-seob takes the job.
cast.title: A Taxi Driver

details.biography: Choi Gwi-Hwa is a South Korean actor, primarily known for his supporting roles in many popular films. Born March 3rd, 1978, he made his acting debut in a minor role in the 2009 film, 'Why Did You Come to My House?'. He has since appeared in many popular films, including 'The Roundup', 'Train to Busan', and 'A Taxi Driver', each hitting over 10 million viewers. He won 'Best New Actor' in 2017 for his role as 'Captain Jeon Il-Man' in 'The Outlaws', reprising his role in 'The Roundup', which hit the 5th highest-grossing film in the Korean Box Office. He has also appeared in many popular television dramas, including 'Incomplete Life', 'Squid Game', and 'Bad Guys: Vile City'.
details.name: Choi Gwi-hwa
details.place_of_birth: Yasu, South Jeolla Province, South Korea
